resources.string: Back stack a lightweight back navigation library for view group based navigation
Press the button below to go to a new screen

There that was easy! You can press back to return to the previous view. Check out the code to learn how to do that. \n\n Next up is animations. It\'s not really that difficult either. Click the button below to see it in action.

Saw how it flew in? Press back to see the remove animation. \n\n Next up is state. New view groups can have state passed in through their constructor. For the demo, we\'re going to pass in a random number to the next view group. The passed in value is persisted through rotations.

Try rotating the screen. You can see that number doesn\'t change even though it was passed in through the view group\'s constructor. Be careful not to capture any references to the activity when using this feature.
This view is retained. Adding a new view to the back stack won\'t destroy this view. This is useful for expensive view groups that shouldn\'t be recreated.
The view is translucent so you can see the retained view underneath. This view was also added to a different container.
Well that\'s it. Press the menu button to return.
